pageTitle: Difference between revisions of "Password special characters" - OWASP
textBeforeTable: Password special characters is an selection of punctuation characters that are present on standard US keyboard and frequently used in passwords. Latest revision as of 08:30, 15 April 2013 | ~ || Tilde || U+007E   | ~ || Tilde || U+007E   |-   |-   U+007D | } || Right brace || + UU+007D | } || Right brace || − |-   |-   | | || Vertical bar || U+007C   | | || Vertical bar || U+007C   Line 67: Line 67: | { || Left brace || U+007B   | { || Left brace || U+007B   |-   |-   (backtick) || U+0060 | ` || Grave accent + | ` || Grave accent || U+0060 − |-   |-
textAfterTable: The same list as string (between double quotes): " !"#$%&'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[\]^_`{|}~" Various operating systems and applications may apply limitations to this set: Oracle Identity Manager and Microsoft Active Directory Retrieved from " https://www.owasp.org/index.php?title=Password_special_characters&oldid=149843" Navigation menu Personal tools Log in Request account Namespaces Page Discussion Variants Views Read View source View history
